FuncDef: The display aps group command displays LMSP group information, including faults in member interfaces, the date and time when faults were rectified, the date and time when K bytes were sent and received, and the interface control status.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the number of an LMSP group.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 192.

Displays verbose information about access users.
-

Examples: No Request on Both Working and Protection Side
Group Work-Channel Protect-Channel Wtr W-State P-State Switch-Cmd Switch-Result
1     Cpos1/0/0     Cpos2/0/0         NA      ok      ok         NA     idle
ExtraInfo: To view LMSP group information, run the display aps group command. The command output includes the LMSP group number, protection switching mode, WTR time, and LMSP group member states, as well as whether SF or SD faults occur.
